page.title: 03Population
page.content: This is a sparsely populated area of scattered owner-occupied farms.The farms are traditionally run by family heirs and therefore there is little movement of population.Some farmers do employ local people,but usually only on a seasonal basis. Boldron Village is the only area of any significant population.It has 30 properties of which 5 are farms.The older type of houses are occupied in the main by local inhabitants,whilst the people who have recently moved to the area tend to live in the newer properties. Of the 64 adults who live in Boldron 10 are retired people.23 children make up the total population of 87 persons. The largest family contains six people and the average family numbers four. Newcomers mix very well.They attend church and join in local activities.
